content:
**Which graph shows a linear function with range $h(x)>-4$?**


[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

options.alt: A coordinate plane. The x- and y-axes each scale by two. A graph of a line intersects the points (negative 3, 2) and (1, negative 1).

choices.content: ![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open, unfilled circle at the point (negative 4, negative 4). There is a line extending from this point upwards and to the left terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/800719a09ad96ff3018d1830d04cd5a1a5c4acaa)

![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (negative 4, negative 4). There is a line extending from this point upwards and to the left terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/8124a2fd4c59139fd10270b39ec717d07d5e15c0)

![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is a filled circle at the point (negative 4, negative 4). There is a line extending from this point downwards and to the right terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/47d72421559ca01dc1d1fbc8ed0a02bc0a38666d)

![A ray of a linear function is graphed. The x and h of x axes go from negative 10 to 10. There is an open, unfilled circle at the point (negative 4, negative 4). There is a line extending from this point downwards and to the right terminating in an arrow at the end of the graph.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5140bdd36a59ac0ae5d284546fd72e94153e6eb5)
